Violation_Type: Failure to meet eligibility criteria for refugee protection
Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD made an unreasonable error in concluding the applicant was not a 'person in need of protection'
Application_Facts: Applicant feared generalized violence in Haiti and claimed specific targeting as a woman
Court_Ruling: The RPD's decision was reasonable and justified by facts and law
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of generalized violence, gender-based risk
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for mixed questions of fact and law
Assessment_Factor: Personal risk, connection to Convention grounds, evidence of targeted harm
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Evidence_Used: Evidence of widespread crime in Haiti affecting all genders
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section defining 'person in need of protection' under IRPA
Application_Basis: Alleged fear of persecution due to gender in context of general instability
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of evidence showing personal risk or targeting based on Convention grounds
Relief_Sought: Recognition as person in need of protection, overturning RPD decision
Governing_Rule: Supreme Court of Canada precedent on reasonableness standard
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove personal risk or nexus to Convention grounds
Harm_Assessment: Generalized violence in Haiti not linked to specific individual risk
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to fear of generalized violence in Haiti, alleging specific targeting as a woman
Evidence_Handling: RPD considered evidence of country conditions but found no personal risk established
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish personal risk or targeting
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 97(1) definition of 'person in need of protection'
Evidence_Assessment: Generalized crime does not equate to persecution on Convention grounds
Decision_Rationale: Fear was based on generalized violence without proof of personal targeting or nexus to protected grounds
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of specific, credible evidence linking applicant to targeted harm
